required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study in Non-squamous Non Small Cell Lung Cancer in Asian Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Post-marketing Clinical Trial of Induction Chemotherapy of Pemetrexed Plus Carboplatin Followed by Pemetrexed Maintenance Therapy for Advanced Nonsquamous Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate efficacy and safety of the combination with pemetrexed plus carboplatin, followed by pemetrexed in patients with advanced nonsquamous Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) who receive at least one dose of the induction therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
primary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to the date of progressive disease (PD) or the date of death from any cause (up to 18 months)
primary_outcome.description: PFS defined as time from enrollment date to first date of objective progression of disease or of death from any cause. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to the date of death from any cause (up to 30.8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from the enrollment date to the date of death from any cause. For participants who were alive, OS was censored at the last contact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to date of progressive disease (up to 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a confirmed CR, PR, or SD. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. SD = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to date of progressive disease (up to 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a confirmed CR or PR. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Stable Disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of maintenance therapy in Cycle 5 (21-day cycle) until the date of measured progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause (up to 24.4 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured from the date of the first dose of the maintenance therapy. Calculated by subtracting induction therapy period from PFS. Tumor response assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0; define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of maintenance therapy in Cycle 5 (21-day cycle) until the date of measured progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause (up to 26.3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the duration from the date of the first dose of the maintenance therapy to the date of death from any cause and was calculated by subtracting the induction therapy period from OS. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy. For participants who were alive, OS was censored at the last contact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of maintenance therapy in Cycle 5 (21-day cycle) until the date of measured progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause (up to 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who achieved confirmed CR (disappearance of all target lesions), PR (30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions), or SD (small changes that do not meet above criteria). Response derived from target lesion assessments performed before maintenance therapy (as baseline), during maintenance therapy (as post-baseline), and non-target lesion assessments performed during maintenance therapy according to RECIST guideline version 1.0, defines when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Observe a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Induction Therapy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to the date of PD, or end of induction period up to Cycle 4 (21-day cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a CR, PR, or SD (confirmed or not). Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. SD = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve a Complete Response (CR) or a Partial Response (PR) During the Induction Therapy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to date of PD, or end of induction period up to Cycle 4 (21-day cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as percentage of participants who achieved a CR or PR (confirmed or not). Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Stable Disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

arm_group.description: After four 21-day cycles of Pemetrexed plus Carboplatin treatment, Pemetrexed monotherapy is continued until study discontinuation.

intervention.description: Induction Therapy: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance Therapy: 500 mg/m^2 given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
Dosage equal to area under the curve (AUC)6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-squamous cell Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) disease
- Clinical stage IIIB/IV or recurrent disease after surgery
- No prior systemic chemotherapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy or biological therapy, including adjuvant therapy
- Prior radiation therapy is allowed to less than 25% of the bone marrow
- Measurable disease as defined by response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST)
- The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 or 1
- Adequate organ function
- Estimated life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant third-space fluid collections
- Central nervous system disease other than stable and treated brain metastasis
- More than 3 weeks interval between the surgery and enrollment request date
- Unable to interrupt aspirin or other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), for a 5 days period
- Unable or unwilling to take folic acid or vitamin B12 supplementation
- Unable to take corticosteroids.
- Serious concomitant disorder that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the patient's ability to adhere to the protocol
- Currently have and historically had interstitial pneumonitis (interstitial pneumonia) or pulmonary fibrosis manifested as opacity on Chest x-ray or Computed tomography (CT)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Induction period: pemetrexed and carboplatin were administered for 4 cycles (1 cycle=21 days). Participants with documented complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) entered the maintenance therapy period (fifth cycle and after). Maintenance period: pemetrexed monotherapy until a discontinuation criterion was met.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

participants_list.participants: Completed induction therapy. Completed=starting the maintenance therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants in Each Smoking Status Category at Study Entry
measure.description: Percentage of participants in each category for smoking status. All of the percentages do not add up to 100% because of rounding.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants in Each Histology Category
measure.description: Percentage of participants in each of the following categories: adenocarcinoma, large cell lung carcinoma, and carcinoma, non-small cell, lung not otherwise specified (NOS).

class.title: Carcinoma, Non-small Cell, Lung Not Otherwise S

measure.title: Percentage of Participants in Each Disease Stage
measure.description: Percentage of participants in each disease stage category. Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body. Stage IIIB - cancer spread to opposite side of chest, more than 1 tumor within same lobe of lung; Stage IV - the cancer has spread to other organs of the body such as the other lung, brain, or liver. All of the percentages do not add up to 100% because of rounding.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants in Each Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Mutation Status Category
measure.description: Percentage of participants in each EGFR mutation status category.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants in Each Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Status
measure.description: ECOG Performance Status (PS). Classifies participants according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death). 0 - Fully Active - Ambulatory, Restricted Strenuous Activity - Ambulatory, No Work Activities - Partially Confined to Bed, Limited Self Care - Completely Disabled - Death

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
outcome.description: PFS defined as time from enrollment date to first date of objective progression of disease or of death from any cause. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to the date of progressive disease (PD) or the date of death from any cause (up to 18 months)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin; 31 participants were censored as they received subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before confirming objective PD or there was not a confirmed objective PD.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21 day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21 day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21 day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
measure.description: PFS defined as time from enrollment date to first date of objective progression of disease or of death from any cause. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin; 31 participants were censored as they received subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before confirming objective PD or there was not a confirmed objective PD.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from the enrollment date to the date of death from any cause. For participants who were alive, OS was censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to the date of death from any cause (up to 30.8 months)
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin; 79 participants were censored as the observation period was not enough at the time of data cut-off for the primary endpoint (EP) of PFS. There were 48 participants censored at the final endpoint data cut-off.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
measure.description: OS was defined as the time from the enrollment date to the date of death from any cause. For participants who were alive, OS was censored at the last contact.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin; 79 participants were censored as the observation period was not enough at the time of data cut-off for the primary endpoint (EP) of PFS. There were 48 participants censored at the final endpoint data cut-off.

measurement_list.measurement: The median and 95% confidence interval were not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the time of the data cutoff.
The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval was not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the time of final data cutoff.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
outcome.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a confirmed CR, PR, or SD. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. SD = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to date of progressive disease (up to 18 months)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. outcome.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a confirmed CR or PR. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Stable Disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) During the Induction and Maintenance Therapy Periods
measure.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a confirmed CR or PR. Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Stable Disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
outcome.description: Measured from the date of the first dose of the maintenance therapy. Calculated by subtracting induction therapy period from PFS. Tumor response assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0; define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
outcome.time_frame: From the start of maintenance therapy in Cycle 5 (21-day cycle) until the date of measured progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause (up to 24.4 months)
outcome.population: Analysis set: Maintenance-treated participants who received maintenance therapy with pemetrexed; 20 and 12 participants were censored at time of primary endpoint (18 months) and final endpoint. They received subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before confirming objective PD or there was not a confirmed objective PD at cut-off.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
measure.description: Measured from the date of the first dose of the maintenance therapy. Calculated by subtracting induction therapy period from PFS. Tumor response assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0; define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy.
measure.population: Analysis set: Maintenance-treated participants who received maintenance therapy with pemetrexed; 20 and 12 participants were censored at time of primary endpoint (18 months) and final endpoint. They received subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before confirming objective PD or there was not a confirmed objective PD at cut-off.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
outcome.description: OS was defined as the duration from the date of the first dose of the maintenance therapy to the date of death from any cause and was calculated by subtracting the induction therapy period from OS. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy. For participants who were alive, OS was censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: From the start of maintenance therapy in Cycle 5 (21-day cycle) until the date of measured progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause (up to 26.3 months)
outcome.population: Analysis set: Maintenance-treated participants, which consist of the participants who received the maintenance therapy with pemetrexed; 56 participants and 38 participants were censored as the observation period was not enough at the time of data cut-off for the primary endpoint, PFS, and final endpoint, respectively.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
measure.description: OS was defined as the duration from the date of the first dose of the maintenance therapy to the date of death from any cause and was calculated by subtracting the induction therapy period from OS. Participants receiving any subsequent systemic anticancer therapy before objective progression or death were censored at date of last objective progression-free disease assessment before starting subsequent systemic anticancer therapy. For participants who were alive, OS was censored at the last contact.
measure.population: Analysis set: Maintenance-treated participants, which consist of the participants who received the maintenance therapy with pemetrexed; 56 participants and 38 participants were censored as the observation period was not enough at the time of data cut-off for the primary endpoint, PFS, and final endpoint, respectively.

measurement_list.measurement: The median and the 95% confidence interval were not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the time of the 2-year data cutoff.
The median and the upper 95% confidence interval were not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the time of final data cutoff.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
outcome.description: Percentage of participants who achieved confirmed CR (disappearance of all target lesions), PR (30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions), or SD (small changes that do not meet above criteria). Response derived from target lesion assessments performed before maintenance therapy (as baseline), during maintenance therapy (as post-baseline), and non-target lesion assessments performed during maintenance therapy according to RECIST guideline version 1.0, defines when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments.
outcome.time_frame: From the start of maintenance therapy in Cycle 5 (21-day cycle) until the date of measured progressive disease (PD) or death from any cause (up to 18 months)
outcome.population: Analysis set: Maintenance-treated participants, which consist of the participants who received the maintenance therapy with pemetrexed.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Maintenance Therapy Period
measure.description: Percentage of participants who achieved confirmed CR (disappearance of all target lesions), PR (30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions), or SD (small changes that do not meet above criteria). Response derived from target lesion assessments performed before maintenance therapy (as baseline), during maintenance therapy (as post-baseline), and non-target lesion assessments performed during maintenance therapy according to RECIST guideline version 1.0, defines when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments.
measure.population: Analysis set: Maintenance-treated participants, which consist of the participants who received the maintenance therapy with pemetrexed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Observe a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Induction Therapy Period
outcome.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a CR, PR, or SD (confirmed or not). Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. SD = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to the date of PD, or end of induction period up to Cycle 4 (21-day cycle)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Observe a Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) During the Induction Therapy Period
measure.description: Calculated as the percentage of participants who achieved a CR, PR, or SD (confirmed or not). Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. SD = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve a Complete Response (CR) or a Partial Response (PR) During the Induction Therapy Period
outcome.description: Calculated as percentage of participants who achieved a CR or PR (confirmed or not). Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Stable Disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: Enrollment to date of PD, or end of induction period up to Cycle 4 (21-day cycle)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.description: Calculated as percentage of participants who achieved a CR or PR (confirmed or not). Tumor response was assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guideline version 1.0, which define when cancer participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR = disappearance of all target lesions. PR = 30% decrease in sum of the longest diameter of target lesions. Progressive Disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Stable Disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consists of the participants who received the induction combination therapy with pemetrexed and carboplatin.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment period plus 30 day follow-up period (up to 30.8 months)
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were updated to add the adverse events occurring after the data cut-off date for the primary endpoint (PFS) to those events previously reported.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Induction therapy period (Pemetrexed + carboplatin): 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) of pemetrexed given intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Carboplatin: dosage equal to the area under the curve (AUC) 6 milligrams per milliliter per minute (mg/mL/min) for participant, given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle for 4 cycles. Maintenance therapy period (pemetrexed monotherapy): 500 mg/m^2 of pemetrexed given IV on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
